main event: Multiple USAF pilots and aircraft observers reported sighting unidentified flying objects near Denver, Colorado on September 28, 1950.
interesting points: The objects were described as being circular in shape, approximately 45-50 feet in diameter, and maneuvering at high speeds with sharp turns.
The objects were observed for approximately 30 minutes, during which time they remained stationary at times.
The objects emitted a brilliant white to orange-red light and made changes in speed, altitude, and appeared to be like a landing light emitting a string of bright sparks.
The sighting was reported to the Air Force, but no further investigation was conducted.
A separate sighting on September 28, 1950 described a bright light about 1.5 times the size of the full moon that hovered and pulsated for over 40 minutes.
sighted object: Circular objects, 45-50 feet in diameter, with brilliant lights
